google/gemini-2.5-pro-preview.mistake: The FOL statement `p_0(Tiana)` translates to "Tiana needs targeted therapy", but the corresponding part of the natural language statement is "Tiana's case needs targeted therapy". The predicate `p_0` is defined as applying to the person (Tiana), not specifically the person's case, based on the provided context: "Text: Tiana does not need targeted therapy. FOL: ¬p_0(Tiana)". In contrast, other predicates, like `p_2(Tiana)` ("Tiana's case needs chemotherapy"), explicitly refer to "Tiana's case". This distinction, being present in the problem's definitions, makes the mapping of `p_0(Tiana)` to "Tiana's case needs targeted therapy" incorrect for the first part of the disjunction.
